original: dbang po gcig sogs thams cad ni //
analyzed: dbang po gcig sogs thams cad ni //
translated: All of them, from one sense faculty on up,

original: khu ba dang ni khrag las byung //
analyzed: khu ba dang ni khrag las byung //
translated: arise from semen and blood.

original: lus kyis su ni mi 'dod de //
analyzed: lus kyis su ni mi 'dod de //
translated: The body is not desired by anyone,

original: skad cig bas na skye bar byed //
analyzed: skad cig bas na skye bar byed //
translated: because it is produced in an instant.

original: ces so // dpe gsungs pa /🔽nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces so // dpe gsungs pa / nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The example is stated:🔽Like fire arising from the stainless sky.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dri ma med pa las me skyes pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dri ma med pa las me skyes pa ste /
translated: Just as fire arises from the stainless sky,

original: de bzhin 'dir zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi nam mkha' las byung ba'i ye shes kyi me'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas kyi gzugs rang gi bag chags kyi skyon dang bral bas sems can rnams la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: de bzhin 'dir zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi nam mkha' las byung ba'i ye shes kyi me'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas kyi gzugs rang gi bag chags kyi skyon dang bral bas sems can rnams la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i
translated: so here, the meaning is that the nature of the fire of wisdom that arises from the sky of wisdom, the form of the Buddha, free from the faults of one's habitual tendencies, creates the light of perfect wisdom for sentient beings.🔽Just as the taste of a single substance

original: don to // ji ltar ro bro ba ni gcig dang dngos la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don to // ji ltar ro bro ba ni gcig dang dngos la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is said to be different in different things,🔽so the form of the Buddha is seen differently🔽by those with different habitual tendencies.🔽Just as the taste of a single substance🔽such as a myrobalan fruit is said to be different

original: skyu ru ra la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig la ro bro bar @37a * //
analyzed: skyu ru ra la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig la ro bro bar @37a * //
translated: in different things such as wine, milk, and water,🔽so the form of the Buddha is seen differently🔽by those with different habitual tendencies.

original: 'gyur te / de'i nang na dngos po mang po zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du yang 'chos pa dang myangs pa dang lces ro de bzhin du gzung ba dang bldad pa dang mid pa rnams kyis lan tshva dang kha ba dang bska ba dang tshva ba dang mngar ba'i rim🔽pa ji ltar go bar bya'o //🔽de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku rnams kyang lha'i mig dang lha'i rna ba dang lha'i sna dang lha'i ro dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang zag pa zad pa rnams kyis sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi
analyzed: 'gyur te / de'i nang na dngos po mang po zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du yang 'chos pa dang myangs pa dang lces ro de bzhin du gzung ba dang bldad pa dang mid pa rnams kyis lan tshva dang kha ba dang bska ba dang tshva ba dang mngar ba'i rim pa ji ltar go bar bya'o // de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku rnams kyang lha'i mig dang lha'i rna ba dang lha'i sna dang lha'i ro dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang zag pa zad pa rnams kyis sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi
translated: In the same way, the tongue, having taken up the taste, having chewed it, having swallowed it, should understand the order of salt, sour, pungent, bitter, and sweet.

original: nang du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: nang du gyur pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the emanation bodies of the Buddhas are in the midst of various sentient beings, with their divine eye, divine ear, divine nose, divine tongue, knowledge of the minds of others, recollection of former lives, and knowledge of the destruction of the outflows.

original: de'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said to have the nature of one and many.

original: gzugs sangs rgyas kyi nyams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs sangs rgyas kyi nyams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The form is the nature of the experience of the Buddha.

original: de rnams kyi nyams zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi nyams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nyams zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi nyams so //
translated: Their experience is the experience of wisdom.

original: nyams thams cad kyi khyab bdag ces bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i dngos po rnams la ye shes kyi ro'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams thams cad kyi khyab bdag ces bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i dngos po rnams la ye shes kyi ro'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The lord of all experiences means that all things have the nature of the taste of wisdom.

original: khyab bdag ni sna tshogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag ni sna tshogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The lord is the perfection of variety.

original: de ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rnams kyis chos bsgrubs pas so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rnams kyis chos bsgrubs pas so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, by accomplishing the Dharma through direct perception and inference, one should practice the yoga of the hero.

original: da ni sems can rnams kyi sngon du bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin de rnams ji ltar las kyi rjes su 'brangs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i tshig gis pho nya rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su
analyzed: da ni sems can rnams kyi sngon du bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin de rnams ji ltar las kyi rjes su 'brangs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i tshig gis pho nya rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su
translated: Now, in order to show how those previously explained natures of the Blessed One in sentient beings are attained through the practice of the hero's yoga, the Blessed One has spoken the verse beginning with following one's karma, and so on.

original: bcad pa bcu gnyis rnams kyis nges par gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcad pa bcu gnyis rnams kyis nges par gsungs pa /
translated: The messengers and so on are definitely taught by the twelve verses beginning with:

original: pho nya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pho nya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The messengers and so on.

original: pho nya zhes bya ba ni rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun ni pho nya'o //
analyzed: pho nya zhes bya ba ni rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun ni pho nya'o //
translated: The messengers are the thirty-seven beginning with Vajravārāhī.

original: des bdag po byas nas shes bya'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin can mngon du bshad pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: des bdag po byas nas shes bya'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin can mngon du bshad pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Having made that the lord, the form-nature of the aspects of the objects of knowledge is the wheel of the nāḍīs that are explained as being manifest.

original: sa gsum zhes bya ba ni khams gsum ste sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid de gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sa gsum zhes bya ba ni khams gsum ste sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid de gnas pa'o //
translated: The “three grounds” are the three realms, which are the characteristics of body, speech, and mind, and they are the abode.

original: za zhes bya ba ni rang gi dus las byung ba'i rnal 'byor ma rnams 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid can rnams za ba ste /
analyzed: za zhes bya ba ni rang gi dus las byung ba'i rnal 'byor ma rnams 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid can rnams za ba ste /
translated: “ Eating” means that the yoginīs who arise from one’s own time eat the three wheels.

original: rang gis rig pa'i bde ba thams cad la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis rig pa'i bde ba thams cad la khyab pa'o //
translated: The bliss of one’s own awareness pervades everything.

original: des na khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyis mtshan ma med pa dang btang snyoms kyis bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyis mtshan ma med pa dang btang snyoms kyis bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should eat with the characteristics of the pervaded and the pervader, without signs and with equanimity.

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Supreme” means the nature of supreme nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir shes rab ces bya ba la sogs @37b pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab ces bya ba la sogs @37b pa ste /
translated: Therefore, “wisdom” and so on.

original: lha gzhan min zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe thabs dang shes rab snying rje chen po'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: lha gzhan min zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe thabs dang shes rab snying rje chen po'i bdag po'o //
translated: “Not another god” means that when there is the lord of great compassion, which is the union of means and wisdom,

original: de bzhin du yang sa gsum gyi sgras 'dod chags min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang sa gsum gyi sgras 'dod chags min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: in the same way, the three stages are not passion, etc.

original: mchog dang bral ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'di rnams la tha dad pa nyid med do //
analyzed: mchog dang bral ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'di rnams la tha dad pa nyid med do //
translated: There is no difference in these, the supreme and innate joys.

original: thams cad lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: thams cad lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that all are of the nature of the innate.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: dbu ma'i yi ge zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i yi ge zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs par sla'o //
translated: up to the middle syllable is easy to understand.

original: dga' ba gsum po 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: dga' ba gsum po 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig gsungs pa /
translated: The definitions of these three joys are stated:🔽Not an object, etc.

original: gzung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzung bya min pa ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzung bya min pa ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: What is not an object is not to be grasped.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dod chags min //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dod chags min //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of things is not passion.

original: dngos po rnams ni phung po la sogs pa thams cad kyi mchog tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi 'dod chags kyis der 'khrul pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i chos kyis dmigs par byed par mi 'gyur te bar du gcig tu ni mchog tu dga' ba
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni phung po la sogs pa thams cad kyi mchog tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi 'dod chags kyis der 'khrul pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i chos kyis dmigs par byed par mi 'gyur te bar du gcig tu ni mchog tu dga' ba
translated: Things are not perceived by the innate nature of passion, which is the supreme delight of all aggregates and so forth, because it is not a supreme delight

original: dang 'dod chags tsam du gnas pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang 'dod chags tsam du gnas pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: that is just passion alone, without interruption.

original: bral ba'i dga' ba la yang chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i dga' ba la yang chags par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be attached even to the delight of separation.

original: de'i don du bral ba'i dga' ba nyams pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don du bral ba'i dga' ba nyams pa ste /
translated: For that reason, the delight of separation is lost.

original: de la yang dga' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la yang dga' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should not delight in that either.

original: bral ba'i dga' ba bsags pa'i ye shes de nyid la dmigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i dga' ba bsags pa'i ye shes de nyid la dmigs par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not focus on that very wisdom that accumulates the delight of separation.

original: de gnyis dbus na gnas pa yi //
analyzed: de gnyis dbus na gnas pa yi //
translated: The dharma that abides in the middle of those two

original: chos de yang dag par dmigs med //
analyzed: chos de yang dag par dmigs med //
translated: is not truly perceived.

original: ces bya ba ste dbus su gnas pa'i mchog dang bral ba gnyis kyi ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i chos gang 'dir rnam par brtags na rgyu rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste dbus su gnas pa'i mchog dang bral ba gnyis kyi ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i chos gang 'dir rnam par brtags na rgyu rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba ste /
translated: This is the Dharma of the innate joy, which is free from the two, i.e., the supreme and the middle, which is imagined here as arising by the power of cause and condition.

original: de nyid la nye bar dmigs pa med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la nye bar dmigs pa med ces bya'o //
translated: That itself is said to be without objective support.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ci zhe na //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ci zhe na //
translated: What is to be accomplished?

original: dpe byar med pa yi ni chos //
analyzed: dpe byar med pa yi ni chos //
translated: The Dharma without example,

original: rdo rje la ni dga' bar gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje la ni dga' bar gyis //
translated: rejoice in the vajra!

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is intended:

original: mi phyed pa'i rdo rje'i ye shes dbye ba med pa'i chos kyi ye shes tshad med pa dpe dang bral ba'i don can la dga' bar gyis zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i rdo rje'i ye shes dbye ba med pa'i chos kyi ye shes tshad med pa dpe dang bral ba'i don can la dga' bar gyis zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Rejoice in the Dharma of the indivisible vajra-wisdom, the immeasurable wisdom of the Dharma, which is free from example, and which has the meaning of the ultimate.

original: de ltar lha'i rnam pa'i rnal 'byor bdag ces bya ba ni sbyor ba 'di yis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgoms pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar lha'i rnam pa'i rnal 'byor bdag ces bya ba ni sbyor ba 'di yis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgoms pa ste /
translated: Thus, by this yoga of the form of the deity, the self, the mandala circle is meditated upon.

original: 'phral du yid ches byed pa can //
analyzed: 'phral du yid ches byed pa can //
translated: Immediately, it is the one who has confidence.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu ster ba po rang gi 'dod pa'i lha bsgom @38a * //🔽pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu ster ba po rang gi 'dod pa'i lha bsgom @38a * // pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the result of the Great Seal, the bestower of the desired deity, by mere meditation.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs byis pa'i skye bo la brten pa gzhan gyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs byis pa'i skye bo la brten pa gzhan gyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in terms of the yoga of others, based on childish beings who are adverse to that, it is said:

original: lugs ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lugs ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The yoga of the image, etc.

original: de ltar sngon du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor spangs nas lugs ma de bzlas pa /
analyzed: de ltar sngon du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor spangs nas lugs ma de bzlas pa /
translated: Thus, abandoning the yoga explained previously, the yoga of the image,

original: ri mo la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la brten pa'o //
translated: is based on the application of painting, etc.

original: des rnam par byas pa'i dbyibs zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i skyes bu'i rnam par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: des rnam par byas pa'i dbyibs zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i skyes bu'i rnam par 'gro ba'o //
translated: The shape created by that is the human form of hell beings, etc.

original: thar pa la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //🔽'di yang / ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags pa'i //
analyzed: thar pa la gnas par mi 'gyur ro // 'di yang / ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags pa'i //
translated: One does not abide in liberation.🔽This also:🔽The external object imagined by the childish

original: phyi rol don ni mi rig ste //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni mi rig ste //
translated: is not known.

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: The mind disturbed by traces

original: don du snang ba rab tu skye //
analyzed: don du snang ba rab tu skye //
translated: arises as the appearance of an object.

original: zhes so // 'on kyang sngon du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor gyis khyad par du byed pa stong pa nyid dang por du ba la sogs pa'i rtags bcus aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du son pa rab tu bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // 'on kyang sngon du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor gyis khyad par du byed pa stong pa nyid dang por du ba la sogs pa'i rtags bcus aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du son pa rab tu bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: Nevertheless, the yoga explained previously is distinguished by the ten signs of smoke, etc. , which are established as entering the central channel.

original: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyis kyang mtshon par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyis kyang mtshon par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It should be illustrated by the yoga of the six limbs.

original: de yang / so sor sdud dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: de yang / so sor sdud dang de bzhin du //
translated: And that is so, because:🔽withdrawal, likewise meditative concentration,

original: bsam gtan srog rtsol 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bsam gtan srog rtsol 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting nge 'dzin //
translated: vitality control, retention, recollection,

original: sbyor ba'i yan lag drug tu 'dod //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i yan lag drug tu 'dod //
translated: and meditative concentration are considered the six limbs of yoga.

original: ces so // des sgom pa po gnas pa po la sogs pa des rang gi gzugs mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ces so // des sgom pa po gnas pa po la sogs pa des rang gi gzugs mthong ba'o //
translated: The meditator, the one who abides, etc. , sees his own form.

original: rang byin brlab pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang byin brlab pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature of the consecration of oneself is so.

original: zhes bya ba ni kha dog sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin rnams su mthong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kha dog sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin rnams su mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seen as having the nature of various colors.

original: de ltar lugs ma la sogs pa la rang bzhin thams cad byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar lugs ma la sogs pa la rang bzhin thams cad byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, one should consecrate all natures in the statue, etc.

original: rang byin gyis brlab pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang byin gyis brlab pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of self-consecration.

original: rang byin brlab ces bya ba la sogs pas rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: rang byin brlab ces bya ba la sogs pas rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The words self-consecration, etc. are easy to understand.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgyu ma zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad thog mar dpe bcu gnyis rnams kyis nye bar mtshon par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgyu ma zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad thog mar dpe bcu gnyis rnams kyis nye bar mtshon par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The words therefore, etc. mean that the word illusion should be understood as the first of the twelve examples of all things.

original: de la sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang me long gi gzugs brnyan dang / brgya byin gyi gzhu dang sprin dang dri za'i grong khyer dang / chu'i zla ba dang / chu'i chu bur dang / gsal snang dang dbang po'i dra ba dang rmi lam dang brag ca'o //
analyzed: de la sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang me long gi gzugs brnyan dang / brgya byin gyi gzhu dang sprin dang dri za'i grong khyer dang / chu'i zla ba dang / chu'i chu bur dang / gsal snang dang dbang po'i dra ba dang rmi lam dang brag ca'o //
translated: The twelve examples are: illusion, mirage, reflection in a mirror, Indra's bow, cloud, fairy city, moon in water, water bubble, firefly, lightning, dream, and echo.

original: de ltar sgyu ma la sogs kun //
analyzed: de ltar sgyu ma la sogs kun //
translated: Thus, all illusions, etc.,

original: rnal 'byor rnams kyi rang mtshan nyid //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnams kyi rang mtshan nyid //
translated: are the characteristics of the yogis.

original: phung po sgyu ma'i rang bzhin te //
analyzed: phung po sgyu ma'i rang bzhin te //
translated: The aggregates are of the nature of illusion.

original: rnam shes brgyad ni smig rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnam shes brgyad ni smig rgyu'o //
translated: The eight consciousnesses are like a mirage.

original: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan kyang //
analyzed: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan kyang //
translated: The reflection in a mirror

original: dbang po rnams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: is the nature of the sense faculties.

original: yul rnams brgya @38b byin gyi ni gzhu //🔽skye mched sprin gyi grib ma'o //
analyzed: yul rnams brgya @38b byin gyi ni gzhu // skye mched sprin gyi grib ma'o //
translated: The objects are the bow of Indra.🔽The sense-fields are the shadow of a cloud.

original: khams ni dri za'i grong khyer te //🔽las kyi dbang po zla ba gang //
analyzed: khams ni dri za'i grong khyer te // las kyi dbang po zla ba gang //
translated: The elements are the city of the Gandharvas.🔽The organs of action are the moon.

original: chu bur las kyi bya ba ste //
analyzed: chu bur las kyi bya ba ste //
translated: The action of the organs is the water-bubble.

original: dngos po rnams ni gsal snang bzhin //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni gsal snang bzhin //
translated: Things are like a reflection.

original: dbang po'i dra ba 'khor ba ste //
analyzed: dbang po'i dra ba 'khor ba ste //
translated: The net of the sense-organs is transmigration.

original: rmi lam dang mnyam blta bar gyis //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mnyam blta bar gyis //
translated: View it as being like a dream.

original: 'dod chags la sogs brag car ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs brag car ni //
translated: Attachment, etc. are like an echo.

original: bsgom par bya zhing bzlog par gyis //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhing bzlog par gyis //
translated: Meditate on them and turn away from them.

original: de phyir 'di rnams sgyu ma che //
analyzed: de phyir 'di rnams sgyu ma che //
translated: Therefore, these are the great illusion.

original: rang bzhin mtha' yi rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mtha' yi rgyal ba'o //
translated: The Victorious Ones are the ultimate nature.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub bla na med pa 'thob ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub bla na med pa 'thob ces bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, one attains the unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: byang chub ces bya ba ni byang chub chen po ste /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba ni byang chub chen po ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the great enlightenment.

original: sgyu ma'i rgyal ba rnams dang dbyer med pa nyid kyis 'od gsal ba rang bzhin gyis 'byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rgyal ba rnams dang dbyer med pa nyid kyis 'od gsal ba rang bzhin gyis 'byung zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the clear light, the natural outflow, by being inseparable from the Victorious Ones of the illusion.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Birth, etc. are easy to understand.

original: 'on kyang / rmi lam dang ni mnyam par mthong //
analyzed: 'on kyang / rmi lam dang ni mnyam par mthong //
translated: they are seen to be like a dream.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub kyang rmi lam bzhin bden pa ma yin brdzun pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub kyang rmi lam bzhin bden pa ma yin brdzun pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because enlightenment is not true like a dream, nor is it false.

original: de la 'di 'dra ba'i ye shes byang chub chen po'i rang bzhin no //🔽ci byas pas 'gro ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la 'di 'dra ba'i ye shes byang chub chen po'i rang bzhin no // ci byas pas 'gro ba gsungs pa /
translated: And this kind of knowledge is the nature of great enlightenment.🔽How is it that the three worlds are made?

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said:🔽Yoga and yogini tantras,

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
translated: Yoga means yoga tantras.

original: rnal 'byor ma zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud de de ltar gnyis po bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud de de ltar gnyis po bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Yogini means yogini tantras. Thus, the two are seventy-two.

original: yang na mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa nas gshin rje 'joms ma'i bar du ste /
analyzed: yang na mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa nas gshin rje 'joms ma'i bar du ste /
translated: Or from dakini and so on up to Yamadhatri.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpal he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor rnams su bdag po can dkyil 'khor re re'i yang rnal 'byor ma re re gtso bo bcu gnyis rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpal he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor rnams su bdag po can dkyil 'khor re re'i yang rnal 'byor ma re re gtso bo bcu gnyis rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The true samādhi is the maṇḍala of Śrī Heruka, and the lords are the individual yoginīs of each maṇḍala, the twelve principal ones.

original: de rnams kyi gtso bo yis so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gtso bo yis so //
translated: They are the principal ones.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can 'khor lo'i rtsibs sum cu rtsa drug pa'i dkyil 'khor so so'i dbus kyi sa gzhi rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can 'khor lo'i rtsibs sum cu rtsa drug pa'i dkyil 'khor so so'i dbus kyi sa gzhi rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The maṇḍala with thirty-six spokes, which has the nature of method and wisdom, is the ground in the center of each maṇḍala.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dbyangs thung ngu rnams kyang sum cu rtsa drug rnams te /🔽aa ai ri au li aam /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dbyangs thung ngu rnams kyang sum cu rtsa drug rnams te / aa ai ri au li aam /
translated: The short vowels of the yoginīs are also thirty-six.🔽A i r i u l i aṃ

original: aee aoo ya ra la wa ae ao /
analyzed: aee aoo ya ra la wa ae ao /
translated: ai o ya ra la va e o

original: ha sha sha:sa ham /
analyzed: ha sha sha:sa ham /
translated: ha ṣa ṣaḥ sa haṃ

original: aaka / aa tsa /
analyzed: aaka / aa tsa /
translated: a ka a ca

original: rita / aub /
analyzed: rita / aub /
translated: ri ti u bha

original: li la / aamksha /
analyzed: li la / aamksha /
translated: li la a kṣa

original: ya ya / ra ra /🔽ba ba / la la /
analyzed: ya ya / ra ra / ba ba / la la /
translated: ya ya ra ra🔽va ba la la

original: ae aee / ao aoo /
analyzed: ae aee / ao aoo /
translated: e ai o au

original: ha ka / sha tsa /
analyzed: ha ka / sha tsa /
translated: ha ka ṣa ca

original: shata / pa pa /🔽sa li / aom ksha /
analyzed: shata / pa pa /🔽sa li / aom ksha /
translated: ṣa ta pa ba🔽sa li a kṣa

original: zhes bya ba ste de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma rnams dang / dpa' bo de rnams dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i sbyor ba rnams gsal byed @39a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma rnams dang / dpa' bo de rnams dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i sbyor ba rnams gsal byed @39a * //
translated: Thus, the yogis and yoginis and the heroes who are in union with them are illuminated.🔽

original: sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: Thus, the yoginīs and those heroes are the thirty-six vowels and consonants.

original: de ni ka kha ga gha da ka / tsa tsha dza dznya nya tsam /
analyzed: de ni ka kha ga gha da ka / tsa tsha dza dznya nya tsam /
translated: They are ka kha ga gha ṅa ka,🔽ca cha ja jha ña ca,🔽ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa ṭa,

original: ta tha da dhana tam /
analyzed: ta tha da dhana tam /
translated: ta tha da dha na ta,

original: pa pha ba bha ma pam /
analyzed: pa pha ba bha ma pam /
translated: pa pha ba bha ma pa,

original: ta tha da dha na tam /
analyzed: ta tha da dha na tam /
translated: ya ra la va ya,🔽śa ṣa sa ha kṣa śa,

original: aa ha / aasha / aasha /
analyzed: aa ha / aasha / aasha /
translated: ṣa sa ha kṣa,

original: aaha / aasa /
analyzed: aaha / aasa /
translated: and a ha.

original: aaksha / zhes bya ba ni rgyud dag tu ste de phyir 'jig rten bdag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: aaksha / zhes bya ba ni rgyud dag tu ste de phyir 'jig rten bdag ces bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, in the pure tantras, therefore, the world is the self.

original: 'di rnams la dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi rgyud dag gis sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje gsum spro ba dang bsdu ba'i byed pa rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi 'jig rten du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi rgyud dag gis sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje gsum spro ba dang bsdu ba'i byed pa rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi 'jig rten du 'byung ba'o //
translated: In these, the vowels and consonants, the emanation and gathering of the three vajras of body and so forth in the pure tantras is the arising of the world of the buddhas.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten rnams kyi sangs rgyas mi 'byung bas 'jig rten pa'i rgyud do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten rnams kyi sangs rgyas mi 'byung bas 'jig rten pa'i rgyud do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, since the buddhas do not arise in the worlds, the intention is that they are worldly tantras.

original: sngags kyi sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngags ni de bzhin du sku ste lha dang lha mo gang rnams kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngags ni de bzhin du sku ste lha dang lha mo gang rnams kyi sku'o //
translated: The so-called mantra body, etc. The mantra is the body, i.e., the body of the gods and goddesses.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid mngon sum zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid mngon sum zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, one’s own direct perception.

original: thung ngu dang ring po'i dbye bas dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams su gnas so //
analyzed: thung ngu dang ring po'i dbye bas dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams su gnas so //
translated: The vowels and consonants are arranged in short and long divisions.

original: rang nyid ni rang byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ni rang byung ba'o //
translated: One’s own is self-arisen.

original: mngon sum du ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Directly is with aspects.

original: de yang 'khor lo gsum rnams su mngon par nyis 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo sdom pa gsum du sngon du bshad pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams te //
analyzed: de yang 'khor lo gsum rnams su mngon par nyis 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo sdom pa gsum du sngon du bshad pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams te //
translated: And that is in the three wheels, doubled, i.e., the vowels and consonants explained previously in the three wheels of Cakrasaṃvara.

original: de nyid 'khor lo gcig go //
analyzed: de nyid 'khor lo gcig go //
translated: That itself is one wheel.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du bshad pa'i nyis 'gyur du bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du bshad pa'i nyis 'gyur du bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be doubled as explained.

original: gnyis pa nyis 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drug go //
analyzed: gnyis pa nyis 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drug go //
translated: The second is doubled, i.e., the six wheels.

original: de yang thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas sngon du bshad pa'i 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de yang thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas sngon du bshad pa'i 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: And that is the nature of the three wheels explained previously through the union of method and wisdom.

original: bshad ces bya ba ni brjod pa ste 'khor lo gsum mo //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba ni brjod pa ste 'khor lo gsum mo //
translated: The expounded is the three wheels.

original: tsa'i yi ges ni 'khor lo dgu'i bdag nyid kyi 'khor lo yang ngo //
analyzed: tsa'i yi ges ni 'khor lo dgu'i bdag nyid kyi 'khor lo yang ngo //
translated: The ca syllable is the wheel itself, which has nine wheels.

original: de'i dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor lo drug so so'i 'khor lo 'khor lo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid de nyis 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor lo drug so so'i 'khor lo 'khor lo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid de nyis 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The its divisions and so on means that each of the six wheels is a wheel of twelve wheels, which is to say, doubled.

original: de ji ltar mi mthun zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar mi mthun zhe na /
translated: How is that incompatible?

original: bshad pa sngar bshad pa'i 'khor lo gsum dang drug dang dgu rnams rtsibs brgyad pa rnams so //
analyzed: bshad pa sngar bshad pa'i 'khor lo gsum dang drug dang dgu rnams rtsibs brgyad pa rnams so //
translated: It is said that the previously explained three, six, and nine wheels are eight-spoked.

original: 'on kyang 'khor lo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid rtsibs sum cu so drug dang mi mthun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor lo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid rtsibs sum cu so drug dang mi mthun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, the twelve wheels are thirty-six spokes, which is incompatible.

original: de ltar gsum dang drug dang dgu dang bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rnams rim pa ji lta bas don dam pa'i dbye bas sku bzhi rnams te lhan cig skyes pa dang chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa rnams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsum dang drug dang dgu dang bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rnams rim pa ji lta bas don dam pa'i dbye bas sku bzhi rnams te lhan cig skyes pa dang chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa rnams su shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the three, six, nine, and twelve wheels are the four bodies in order, by way of the ultimate divisions, which should be understood as the innate, the dharma, the enjoyment, and the emanation bodies.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khams gsum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The three realms, etc.

original: @39b lus la sogs pa'i khams gsum ni 'jig rten gsum ste /
analyzed: @39b lus la sogs pa'i khams gsum ni 'jig rten gsum ste /
translated: The three realms of the body, etc. are the three worlds.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir gnas chen po ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir gnas chen po ste /
translated: Because they are the great abode here,

original: gnas de rnams ni dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas de rnams ni dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: those abodes are called the nature of the mandala wheel.

original: 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid can sku bzhi rnams kyang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o//
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid can sku bzhi rnams kyang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o//
translated: The four bodies, which are the nature of the three wheels, also abide as the nature of the mandala wheel.

original: lhag ma'i dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams ni le'u bco lnga par 'chad par 'gyur bas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma'i dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams ni le'u bco lnga par 'chad par 'gyur bas bshad par bya ste /
translated: The remaining vowels and consonants will be explained in chapter fifteen,🔽so they should be explained there.

original: lhan skyes chen po dang chos chen po dang longs spyod rdzogs pa chen po dang / sprul pa chen po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: lhan skyes chen po dang chos chen po dang longs spyod rdzogs pa chen po dang / sprul pa chen po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The great innate, the great Dharma, the great enjoyment, and the great emanation are intended.

original: 'di gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /🔽rdo rje phag mo bdag nyid kyi skyon spang ngo //
analyzed: 'di gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni / rdo rje phag mo bdag nyid kyi skyon spang ngo //
translated: This is said, etc.🔽It is the abandonment of the faults of one's own Vajravārāhī.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Vajra is Mahāvajradhara.

original: de yang dpa' bo chen po'i dbang phyug de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang dpa' bo chen po'i dbang phyug de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ste /
translated: The great hero, the lord of all the Tathagatas,🔽is the great hero, the lord of those twelve wheels and so forth, who is endowed with the highest perfection by the nature of true concentration, mundane and supramundane.🔽The Tathagatas are the heroes, and the word “goes” means “knowledge.”🔽He is the Bhagavat, the essence of all, who has entered into the various elements, who is firm, who has become the individual appearances of his own body in the migrations and so forth, who is free from the senses and so forth, who is the Dharma that is taught,

original: dpa' bo chen po ni 'khor lo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid la sogs pa de rnams la dbang phyug pa ste yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyis mchog tu phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po ni 'khor lo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid la sogs pa de rnams la dbang phyug pa ste yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyis mchog tu phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
translated: who is the great hero, the lord of all the Tathagatas, who is endowed with the highest perfection by the nature of true concentration, mundane and supramundane.🔽The Tathagatas are the heroes, and the word “goes” means “knowledge.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dpa' bo rnams te gshegs pa'i sgra ni ye shes kyi don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dpa' bo rnams te gshegs pa'i sgra ni ye shes kyi don to //
translated: He is the Bhagavat, the essence of all, who has entered into the various elements, who is firm, who has become the individual appearances of his own body in the migrations and so forth, who is free from the senses and so forth, who is the Dharma that is taught,🔽who is the great hero, the lord of all the Tathagatas, who is endowed with the highest perfection by the nature of true concentration, mundane and supramundane.🔽The Tathagatas are the heroes, and the word “goes” means “knowledge.”🔽He is the Bhagavat, the essence of all, who has entered into the various elements, who is firm, who has become the individual appearances of his own body in the migrations and so forth, who is free from the senses and so forth, who is the Dharma that is taught,

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das te thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa khams sna tshogs pa'i nang du son pa brtan pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa rang rang gi sku so sor snang bar gyur pa dbang po la sogs pa dang bral ba gsungs pa'i chos mtshon
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das te thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa khams sna tshogs pa'i nang du son pa brtan pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa rang rang gi sku so sor snang bar gyur pa dbang po la sogs pa dang bral ba gsungs pa'i chos mtshon
translated: who is the great hero, the lord of all the Tathagatas, who is endowed with the highest perfection by the nature of true concentration, mundane and supramundane.🔽The Tathagatas are the heroes, and the word “goes” means “knowledge.”🔽He is the Bhagavat, the essence of all, who has entered into the various elements, who is firm, who has become the individual appearances of his own body in the migrations and so forth, who is free from the senses and so forth, who is the Dharma that is taught,🔽who is the great hero, the lord of all the Tathagatas, who is endowed with the highest perfection by the nature of true concentration,

original: par byed pa ye shes dang shes bya 'dres pa'i bdag nyid can dpa' bo thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor bas rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje'i rol pas rnam par 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba las rang gi ngo bo nyid mdzes pa bskyed pa'o
analyzed: par byed pa ye shes dang shes bya 'dres pa'i bdag nyid can dpa' bo thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor bas rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje'i rol pas rnam par 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba las rang gi ngo bo nyid mdzes pa bskyed pa'o
translated: The hero Vajrasattva, who is the nature of the union of gnosis and the object of knowledge, is the one who generates the beauty of his own nature from the bliss of the nature of the one who holds the vajra play, through union with all heroes.

original: // mchog ni gtso bo bde ba'o //
analyzed: // mchog ni gtso bo bde ba'o //
translated: Supreme is the best bliss.

original: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'o //
translated: Vajra is indivisible.

original: thams cad kyi rang bzhin thams cad rnam par spangs pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang bzhin thams cad rnam par spangs pa /
translated: The nature of all is abandoned in all.

original: thams cad gcig tu gyur pas sems dpa'o //
analyzed: thams cad gcig tu gyur pas sems dpa'o //
translated: The mind is the one that has become one with all.

original: de'i phyir dpa' bo thams cad las kyi tshogs kyi rang bzhin du gnas te ye shes kyi rnam par ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpa' bo thams cad las kyi tshogs kyi rang bzhin du gnas te ye shes kyi rnam par ro //
translated: Therefore, the hero abides in the nature of the aggregate of actions, the nature of gnosis.

original: de rnams kyi mnyam par sbyor ba ni sna tshogs pa'i nyi ma dang 'pho ba dang sngags bzlas pa rnams kyis dpa' bo thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor bas gsungs so zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mnyam par sbyor ba ni sna tshogs pa'i nyi ma dang 'pho ba dang sngags bzlas pa rnams kyis dpa' bo thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor bas gsungs so zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
translated: Their union is the union with all heroes through the various sun movements and mantra recitations.

original: da ni klu'i sngags kyi sgo nas 'chad par @40a * //
analyzed: da ni klu'i sngags kyi sgo nas 'chad par @40a * //
translated: Now, it will be explained from the perspective of the mantra of the nāgas.🔽🔽

original: 'gyur ba'i gtor ma dang 'khor lo mchod pa dag gi de kho na nyid ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i gtor ma dang 'khor lo mchod pa dag gi de kho na nyid ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, he declares the reality of the bali and the worship of the wheel, which are to be explained by way of the naga mantra.

original: chos dang chos min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang chos min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reality of the bali and the worship of the wheel is declared in Dharma and adharma, etc.

original: chos dang chos min gang du nub //
analyzed: chos dang chos min gang du nub //
translated: Where dharma and adharma set,

original: ces bya ba ni gnas gang du nub par gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i nang du gyur pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag kyang rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gnas gang du nub par gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i nang du gyur pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag kyang rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: wherever the place where they set, in the inner radiance of the nature, the accumulations of merit and knowledge are purified.

original: byang chub der ni yid gzung gyis //
analyzed: byang chub der ni yid gzung gyis //
translated: Hold the mind there in enlightenment!

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i gnas su nyid kyis lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyi bod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i gnas su nyid kyis lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyi bod pa'o //
translated: In the place of natural inner radiance, he holds the mind of the gods, titans, etc., who are to be explained by him.

original: byang chub yid ces bya ba ni lha dang mi rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sems chings shig pa ni mngon sum du rtogs par gyis shig pa'o //🔽grub pa lha dang lha ma yin //
analyzed: byang chub yid ces bya ba ni lha dang mi rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sems chings shig pa ni mngon sum du rtogs par gyis shig pa'o // grub pa lha dang lha ma yin //
translated: The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual. 🔽The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems te gang zag gcig 'ba' zhig gis ma yin te rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //🔽gzhan yang grub pa dang lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa rang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa gang rnams kyi mngon sum du rang gis de bzhin du za ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems te gang zag gcig 'ba' zhig gis ma yin te rnam par rtog pa med pa'o // gzhan yang grub pa dang lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa rang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa gang rnams kyi mngon sum du rang gis de bzhin du za ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The accomplishment is the mind of awakening, which is not just for one person, but is nonconceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ring du byed par 'gyur ba'o //🔽'gro ba dang ni 'ong ba 'chad //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ring du byed par 'gyur ba'o //🔽'gro ba dang ni 'ong ba 'chad //
translated: The accomplish

original: ces bya ba ni de rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyis 'khor ba'i rgyun rnams 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang rnam par shes pa yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyis 'khor ba'i rgyun rnams 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang rnam par shes pa yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, their non-conceptuality, etc., are the samādhis that interrupt the coming and going of the continuum of saṃsāra and consciousness.

original: spyod lam la sogs pa'i chos thams cad len pas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: spyod lam la sogs pa'i chos thams cad len pas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is thought that all phenomena, such as conduct, are taken up.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa'i tshul rnams dang tha mal pa'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi yang 'khor lo mchod pa dang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid dang gtor ma'i las kyis kyang de bzhin du 'dag ste phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa'i tshul rnams dang tha mal pa'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi yang 'khor lo mchod pa dang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid dang gtor ma'i las kyis kyang de bzhin du 'dag ste phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi
translated: Likewise, the śrāvakas, etc., and those who are ordinary beings are purified by the worship of the cakra, the nature of natural luminosity, and the rite of bali.

original: dngos po'o // 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: dngos po'o // 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: chos ni 'od gsal byang chub ste //
analyzed: chos ni 'od gsal byang chub ste //
translated: The Dharma is the clear light of enlightenment.

original: chos min rtog pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: chos min rtog pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The non-Dharma is the latent tendencies of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa nub pa na //🔽byang chub ces bya rnam rtog yin //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nub pa na // byang chub ces bya rnam rtog yin //
translated: When conceptualization subsides,🔽it is called “enlightenment,” but that is a concept.

original: rnam rtog bral ba byang chub ste //
analyzed: rnam rtog bral ba byang chub ste //
translated: Enlightenment is free from concepts.

original: sangs rgyas phan dgongs mdzad rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phan dgongs mdzad rnams kyi'o //
translated: The buddhas, who are intent on benefiting others,

original: mi rnams kyis ni gzung bya ba //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni gzung bya ba //
translated: are to be grasped by people

original: gtor ma mchod sogs de'i bdag nyid //
analyzed: gtor ma mchod sogs de'i bdag nyid //
translated: through the nature of offerings, worship, and so forth.

original: grub pa lha dang lha min sogs //
analyzed: grub pa lha dang lha min sogs //
translated: The gods, demigods, and so forth are accomplished🔽through the nature of the momentary consumption

original: rang bzhin skad cig gis bza' bya //
analyzed: rang bzhin skad cig gis bza' bya //
translated: of one's own nature.

original: rang gis rang @40b bzhin 'dzin pa na //
analyzed: rang gis rang @40b bzhin 'dzin pa na //
translated: When one grasps one's own nature,

original: 'gro dang 'ong ba rnam par spangs //
analyzed: 'gro dang 'ong ba rnam par spangs //
translated: one abandons going and coming.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: nga ni gzhan yang sngon du gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i rigs pas rnam par dag pas dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa dang dbang bskur ba dang sbyin sreg gi thabs dang slob dpon gyi yon la sogs pa dang rab gnas kyi rnam par dag pa yang
analyzed: nga ni gzhan yang sngon du gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i rigs pas rnam par dag pas dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa dang dbang bskur ba dang sbyin sreg gi thabs dang slob dpon gyi yon la sogs pa dang rab gnas kyi rnam par dag pa yang
translated: Moreover, by the reasoning of this previously stated verse, the purification of the mandala, the consecration, the method of homa, the master's fee, and so forth, and the purification of the consecration

original: bshad de / der yang dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdor bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bshad de / der yang dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdor bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: are explained. There, the brief explanation is stated by one verse beginning with the sense faculties, and so forth:

original: dbang po ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dbang po ni dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The sense faculties are the mandala.

original: de'i thig gdab pa ni rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thig gdab pa ni rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: The piercing of that is the analysis.

original: yul ni dbang bskur te sna tshogs pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ni dbang bskur te sna tshogs pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The object is the consecration, because of the nature of various kinds of bliss.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: All means the eye and so forth.

original: khams ni zhes bya ba ni khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa gtum mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bsreg par bya ba ste sbyin sreg gi thab bo //
analyzed: khams ni zhes bya ba ni khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa gtum mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bsreg par bya ba ste sbyin sreg gi thab bo //
translated: The elements means semen, blood, and so forth, which are to be burned in the middle of the mandala of Caṇḍālī, the method of the fire sacrifice.

original: skye mched rnams zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi rang bzhin nyid pas so //
analyzed: skye mched rnams zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi rang bzhin nyid pas so //
translated: The sense bases means because of the nature of the master.

original: slob dpon gyi yon ni sems can rnams yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi lam rnams su rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi yon ni sems can rnams yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi lam rnams su rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: The master's fee is the engagement of sentient beings in the path of perfect enlightenment.

original: ni'i yi ges rab gnas kyi rnam par dag pa ste rang gi rig pa'i ye shes dang 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ni'i yi ges rab gnas kyi rnam par dag pa ste rang gi rig pa'i ye shes dang 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The syllable ni is the purity of consecration, the nature of one's awareness wisdom and the aspect of clear light.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyi ye shes skye ba dang ni 'gag pa ste zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyi ye shes skye ba dang ni 'gag pa ste zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: Thus, the arising and cessation of the wisdom of the nature means by the characteristic of the aspect of illusion.

original: de dang bral ba gang yin pa ni 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: de dang bral ba gang yin pa ni 'ching ba ste /
translated: That which is free from that is bondage.

original: de nyid de bzhin du gsungs pa //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin du gsungs pa //
translated: That is just as it is said.

original: rmongs pa rnams te 'khor ba la kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnams te 'khor ba la kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: The confused are those who are confused about cyclic existence.

original: des mkhas pa ste skye bo gzhan rmongs pa nges par sgrol ba zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: des mkhas pa ste skye bo gzhan rmongs pa nges par sgrol ba zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: By that, the wise are those who definitely liberate other confused people.

original: bzo sogs rang gi rigs rnams kyis //
analyzed: bzo sogs rang gi rigs rnams kyis //
translated: By their own kinds, such as crafts,

original: dngos po kun la mkhas pa dang // yi ge gcig gis mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: dngos po kun la mkhas pa dang // yi ge gcig gis mkhas pa ni //
translated: and by all things, and by one letter,

original: kun mkhyen thams cad rig pa mchog / ces so //
analyzed: kun mkhyen thams cad rig pa mchog / ces so //
translated: the wise are the supreme omniscient knowers of all.

original: da ni dgrol zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan pa rnams kyis mchod pa bzhi la sogs pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: da ni dgrol zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan pa rnams kyis mchod pa bzhi la sogs pa ston pa ste /
translated: Now, in one verse, beginning with “liberation,” he teaches the four offerings and so forth.

original: 'on kyang spyi bsdus pas dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis yul la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa 'joms par gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi bsdus pas dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis yul la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa 'joms par gsungs pa /
translated: However, by a general summary, in two verses, beginning with “the sense powers,” up to “abide,” he teaches the destruction of the conceptions of object and so forth as subject and object.

original: yongs su shes pas 'grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pas 'grol ba'o //
translated: By thorough knowledge, there is liberation.

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams 'khrul pas @41a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams 'khrul pas @41a * //
translated: Thus, the aggregates, elements, media, etc. are bound by the non-understanding of the aggregates, etc.

original: dri za'i grong khyer lta bur yongs su ma shes pas 'ching ba'o //🔽skye ba dang 'gag pa rnam par dpyad pas dngos po med pa'i phyir de rnams kyis yongs su shes pa dang lhan cig rnam par dbyang pas ma 'khrul pas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam par yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mchod pa bzhi la sogs pa de
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer lta bur yongs su ma shes pas 'ching ba'o // skye ba dang 'gag pa rnam par dpyad pas dngos po med pa'i phyir de rnams kyis yongs su shes pa dang lhan cig rnam par dbyang pas ma 'khrul pas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam par yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mchod pa bzhi la sogs pa de
translated: as they are, due to error, like a city of gandharvas.🔽But when they are understood, they are liberated by the four kinds of worship, etc.,

original: kho na nyid rnams kyis dgrol ba ste /
analyzed: kho na nyid rnams kyis dgrol ba ste /
translated: which are going to be explained, since they are naturally radiant, due to the non-error of the simultaneous analysis with the understanding that things do not exist, because of the analysis of origination and cessation.

original: rmongs pas yongs su shes pa spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmongs pas yongs su shes pa spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is: “By the understanding of the aggregates, etc. as they are, one is liberated from the bondage of error.”🔽The mind itself is the absence of the various things, such as pots, cloth, etc.

original: sems nyid ces bya ba ni sna tshogs pa bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa ste sna tshogs gcig gi rnam pa nyid pas dngos su mchod pa'i khams gsum gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyid ces bya ba ni sna tshogs pa bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa ste sna tshogs gcig gi rnam pa nyid pas dngos su mchod pa'i khams gsum gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the nature of the one, the various, and so it is the abode of the three worlds.

original: lus la sogs pa'i khams su gnas par bshad pas 'od gsal ba'i sems de ston pa'i dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid chos thams cad yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i khams su gnas par bshad pas 'od gsal ba'i sems de ston pa'i dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid chos thams cad yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Since it is explained as abiding in the elements of the body, etc., that clear light mind is the perfection of wisdom, the nature of the Teacher, the thorough knowledge of all phenomena.

original: des de bzhin du bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de bzhin du bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, it is explained in the same way.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Also, it is stated:

original: sna tshogs 'od gsal ba ni ma //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'od gsal ba ni ma //
translated: The various clear light is not the mother,

original: dngos po kun gyi pha yis ni //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi pha yis ni //
translated: But the father of all things🔽Generates and likewise

original: skyed par byed cing de bzhin du //🔽srun te kun rdzob tu ni son //🔽'od gsal dang bral byang chub ni //
analyzed: skyed par byed cing de bzhin du // srun te kun rdzob tu ni son // 'od gsal dang bral byang chub ni //
translated: Protects conventionally.🔽Without clear light,

original: bdag byin brlab pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag byin brlab pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: Awakening is not seen in self-consecration.

original: de yis byang chub nges shes pas //🔽bstan bya ston pa dbyer med de //
analyzed: de yis byang chub nges shes pas // bstan bya ston pa dbyer med de //
translated: Since that is known as awakening,🔽The object of expression and the expression are inseparable.

original: kun rdzob dang ni don dam pa //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ni don dam pa //
translated: The conventional and the ultimate,

original: gtso bo dang ni dkyil 'khor pa //
analyzed: gtso bo dang ni dkyil 'khor pa //
translated: The principal and the retinue,

original: rnam pa gcig tu rig gang gis //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu rig gang gis //
translated: Are known as one.

original: de ni bsrung ba kun du son //
analyzed: de ni bsrung ba kun du son //
translated: That is the protection that has been reached.

original: zhes so // da ni 'di rnams kyi srung ba drug rnams kyi go cha la sogs pa'i le'u rnams kyi bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa drug rnams kyis mdor bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // da ni 'di rnams kyi srung ba drug rnams kyi go cha la sogs pa'i le'u rnams kyi bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa drug rnams kyis mdor bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, here, in the chapters on armor and so forth of the six protective ones, the six verses beginning with “self” are stated as a summary:

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Self” and so forth.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang dpal ye shes kyi rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang dpal ye shes kyi rgya mtsho'o //
translated: Great Vajradhara and glorious Jñānasāgara.🔽“You” and so forth.

original: khyod dang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje phag mo dang snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: khyod dang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje phag mo dang snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Vajravārāhī and union.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog gi dga' ba las bral ba'i thog ma ste /
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog gi dga' ba las bral ba'i thog ma ste /
translated: “Supreme” is the first separation from supreme joy.

original: de gnyis su med pa dag las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis su med pa dag las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from those two non-dualities.

original: tshogs kyi gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshogs kyi gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Chief of the assembly” is

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: the co-emergent natural Bhagavān.

original: ma byung ba ni 'khrul pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par ma skyes pa ste dbang po la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ma byung ba ni 'khrul pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par ma skyes pa ste dbang po la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis so //
translated: “Unarisen” is the non-arising of the consciousness of delusion, due to being free from the sense powers and so forth.

original: 'o na nyan thos la sogs pa'i tshul sna tshogs pa'i chos bcom ldan 'das @41b kyis bstan /
analyzed: 'o na nyan thos la sogs pa'i tshul sna tshogs pa'i chos bcom ldan 'das @41b kyis bstan /
translated: Well then, the Bhagavān taught the Dharma in various ways, such as the way of the śrāvakas.

original: de ji ltar ma byung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma byung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin /
translated: How is that the unarisen, connate nature?

original: de ji ltar de yang 'khrul pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can dbang po dang bral bas bstan par bya ba'i dngos po med pa nyid la ston pa po dang bral na thams cad don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ji ltar de yang 'khrul pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can dbang po dang bral bas bstan par bya ba'i dngos po med pa nyid la ston pa po dang bral na thams cad don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: How is that also the nature of deluded wisdom? Since it is devoid of the sense faculties, there is no object to be taught. If it is devoid of a teacher, everything becomes meaningless.

original: de'i phyir de'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, in that regard, it is explained:

original: gang smras pa de bden te /
analyzed: gang smras pa de bden te /
translated: What was said is true.

original: 'on kyang byis pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa med do //
translated: However, it is not imagined by those of childish nature.

original: ci'i phyir med /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med /
translated: Why is it not?

original: smras pa / ma 'khrul ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma 'khrul ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
translated: It was said: The nondeluded is the connate wisdom of the buddhas.

original: ji ltar me long la rlangs kyis khyab pa dri ma med par song ba bzhin shin tu rnam par dag pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad du nub par gyur pa'i sems bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang bral ba de 'dzin pa la rnam par shes
analyzed: ji ltar me long la rlangs kyis khyab pa dri ma med par song ba bzhin shin tu rnam par dag pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad du nub par gyur pa'i sems bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang bral ba de 'dzin pa la rnam par shes
translated: Just as a mirror, when covered with tarnish, is not clear, so the mind, when covered with the stains of conceptualization, is not clear.

original: pa brgyad la sogs pa len pa las sems can gyi tshogs kyang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa brgyad la sogs pa len pa las sems can gyi tshogs kyang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is free from the states of pleasure, etc., and has become completely pure, having subsided into all conceptualization, then, in the absence of the apprehension of the duality of object and subject, the mind, which is the basis of the apprehension of the eight consciousnesses, etc., does not arise.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid can dang sems can lhag ma rnams 'dren par 'dod pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi lam 'thob par bya ba'i phyir sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du ston pa ste smos ci dgos /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid can dang sems can lhag ma rnams 'dren par 'dod pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi lam 'thob par bya ba'i phyir sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du ston pa ste smos ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention the desire of the Lord, whose nature is such, to lead the rest of sentient beings to attain the path of enlightenment?

original: de'i chos gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i chos gsungs pa /
translated: He teaches the Dharma for that purpose,

original: spyod lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: spyod lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: in the form of an illusion.🔽He teaches the Dharma in the form of an illusion, as follows:

original: spyod lam zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
translated: The way of life is the vehicle of the disciples.

original: de la bslab pa'i tshul gyis thog mar sems can rnams 'jug par byed de 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa gnyis kyi gzhung rgya chen po la'o //
analyzed: de la bslab pa'i tshul gyis thog mar sems can rnams 'jug par byed de 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa gnyis kyi gzhung rgya chen po la'o //
translated: In the first place, he introduces sentient beings to the scriptures of the Vinaya and Abhidharma, which are extensive texts, by means of the method of training.

original: sogs kyi sgras sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos dang rtog gi sna tshogs pa dang spyod pa sna tshogs pa'i pha rol po'i grub mtha' yang ngo //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos dang rtog gi sna tshogs pa dang spyod pa sna tshogs pa'i pha rol po'i grub mtha' yang ngo //
translated: The words “and so on” in the root text refer to the non-Buddhist treatises, the various philosophical systems, and the various kinds of conduct.

original: bye brag chos zhes bya bas ni mu stegs dang kha che bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa'i chos kyang ngo //
analyzed: bye brag chos zhes bya bas ni mu stegs dang kha che bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa'i chos kyang ngo //
translated: The words “and the Dharma” in the root text refer to the Dharma of the tīrthikas, the Vaibhāṣikas, and so on.

original: mdo sde zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i sde snod de theg pa chen po'i mdo sde sna tshogs kyang ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i sde snod de theg pa chen po'i mdo sde sna tshogs kyang ngo //
translated: The words “the sūtras” refer to the scriptural collection of the sūtras, and also to the various Mahāyāna sūtras.

original: rnam shes zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa tsam gyi chos sangs rgyas kyi yum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa tsam gyi chos sangs rgyas kyi yum la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words “consciousness” refer to the Dharma of consciousness only, such as the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: dbu ma zhes bya ba ni snying po'i chos dang theg pa chen po'i dbu ma chen po mtha' bzhi dang bral ba skal pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi byang chub po //
analyzed: dbu ma zhes bya ba ni snying po'i chos dang theg pa chen po'i dbu ma chen po mtha' bzhi dang bral ba skal pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi byang chub po //
translated: The middle is the essence of the Dharma, the Great Vehicle, the Great Middle free from the four extremes, the enlightenment of the fortunate.

original: de ltar thams cad gzhung ches kyis dogs pa'i 'jigs pas bdag gis ma bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad gzhung ches kyis dogs pa'i 'jigs pas bdag gis ma bshad de /
translated: Thus, fearing excessive length, I have not explained it all here.

original: sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa'i bstan bcos rnams su nye bar mtshon par @42a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa'i bstan bcos rnams su nye bar mtshon par @42a * //
translated: It should be understood from the treatises taught by the various Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: bya'o ; / de'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: bya'o ; / de'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not so.

original: de ji ltar sna tshogs pa'i bstan bcos rnams gal te de srid sangs rgyas rnams kyis skabs phye ba las sems can gyi khams de bstan bcos gcig kyang 'dul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ji ltar sna tshogs pa'i bstan bcos rnams gal te de srid sangs rgyas rnams kyis skabs phye ba las sems can gyi khams de bstan bcos gcig kyang 'dul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How is it that if the various treatises were taught by the Buddhas, the realm of sentient beings would be tamed by just one treatise?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mos pa'i sems can la bshad pa /
analyzed: mos pa'i sems can la bshad pa /
translated: For sentient beings with faith, it is explained.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: phyi ma'i dus su sna tshogs pa'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rnams kyi mos pa dang rang rang gi bsam pa rnams gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos gsungs te sh'akya thub pa 'ba' zhig gis gsungs pa ma yin te bskal pa bzang po 'di'i dbus su rnam
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus su sna tshogs pa'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rnams kyi mos pa dang rang rang gi bsam pa rnams gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos gsungs te sh'akya thub pa 'ba' zhig gis gsungs pa ma yin te bskal pa bzang po 'di'i dbus su rnam
translated: In the future, he will teach treatises that clarify the inclinations and individual thoughts of sentient beings who have various thoughts.

original: par gzigs la sogs pas kyang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: par gzigs la sogs pas kyang bstan pa'o //
translated: The teachings were not given only by Śākyamuni, but also by Vipaśyin and so on, in the middle of this fortunate eon.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bzhud pa'am byon pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rkyen tsam gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bzhud pa'am byon pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rkyen tsam gyis ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the tathāgatas do not come or go due to the mere conditions of things.

original: rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis so //🔽des na / bden pa ma yin brdzun pa min //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis so // des na / bden pa ma yin brdzun pa min //
translated: It is due to the power of the assembly of causes and conditions.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “They are neither true nor false.”

original: dngos po thams cad dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dam pa'i dngos po yang mi bden pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i ye shes te thams cad mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dam pa'i dngos po yang mi bden pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i ye shes te thams cad mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all things and even the holy things such as the buddhas are false, they are the wisdom of error, because everything is impossible.

original: de yod pa ma yin te ye shes dang shes bya dang shes pa dang shes pa po rang gi ngo bos mi bden pa dang thams cad rnam par rtog pa nub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin te ye shes dang shes bya dang shes pa dang shes pa po rang gi ngo bos mi bden pa dang thams cad rnam par rtog pa nub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That does not exist, because the wisdom, the object of knowledge, the knowledge, and the knower are not real by nature, and because all conceptual thoughts have disappeared.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The nature that is connate with the buddhas and so on is also that.

original: brdzun pa min zhes bya ba ni rang gis 'di ltar rtog pa las byung bas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: brdzun pa min zhes bya ba ni rang gis 'di ltar rtog pa las byung bas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: “Not false” means that desire and so on arise from the conception that arises from one’s own thoughts.

original: ji ltar la la na yang smyug ma la sogs pa'i yal ga nags thibs por rlung gis bskyed par gyur pas g-yo ba nyid dang sa gcig la gcig drud pa las sgra 'byung ba dang slar yang du ba dang 'od zer 'phro ba dang 'bar ba'i bar du
analyzed: ji ltar la la na yang smyug ma la sogs pa'i yal ga nags thibs por rlung gis bskyed par gyur pas g-yo ba nyid dang sa gcig la gcig drud pa las sgra 'byung ba dang slar yang du ba dang 'od zer 'phro ba dang 'bar ba'i bar du
translated: Just as, for example, in a dense forest, the wind causes the branches of bamboo and so on to move, and from that contact with each other, a sound arises, and then again smoke, light rays, and even the state of being aflame

original: 'byung ste nags thams cad kyi mthar bsreg go //
analyzed: 'byung ste nags thams cad kyi mthar bsreg go //
translated: arises, and in the end, the entire forest burns.

original: slar yang myu gu bsreg go //
analyzed: slar yang myu gu bsreg go //
translated: Again, the sprouts burn.

original: de bzhin du yang nas yang du byed de nags ji srid ces bya bar nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang nas yang du byed de nags ji srid ces bya bar nges pa'o //
translated: In that way, it happens again and again. The forest is as long as it is.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang sems can rnams kyi rang nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ba ste dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang sems can rnams kyi rang nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ba ste dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs so //
translated: Likewise, the Buddhas and so on and all sentient beings arise from their own conceptualization, that is, from virtue, nonvirtue, and so on.

original: dge ba las sangs rgyas rnams rang gi bdag nyid nas par mi rtog par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba las sangs rgyas rnams rang gi bdag nyid nas par mi rtog par byed do //
translated: From virtue, the Buddhas act without conceptualization for their own sake.

original: yang nas yang du de'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang nas yang du de'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Again and again, they attain that state.

original: mi dge ba las 'gro ba drug na gnas pa'i sems can rnams rang nyid kyis bsreg go //
analyzed: mi dge ba las 'gro ba drug na gnas pa'i sems can rnams rang nyid kyis bsreg go //
translated: From nonvirtue, sentient beings who abide in the six realms burn themselves.

original: yang @42b nas yang du de nyid du 'gro ba 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang @42b nas yang du de nyid du 'gro ba 'dzin to //
translated: Again and again, they take rebirth in that very state.

original: de'i phyir dge ba'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos ston par so sor gsal pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos ston par so sor gsal pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by the power of virtue, the Buddhas teach the Dharma, and by the power of nonvirtue, sentient beings abide in the six realms.

original: nyon mongs pa dam po can rnams kyis ni 'gro ba drug rnams su gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dam po can rnams kyis ni 'gro ba drug rnams su gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are full of afflictions abide in the six realms.

original: de rnams kyi dge ba'i bag chags kyis rnam par rtog pa med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dge ba'i bag chags kyis rnam par rtog pa med pa yang ngo //
translated: By the imprints of their virtue, they are without conceptualization.

original: bshad pa rnams kyis kyang brdzun pa min zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
analyzed: bshad pa rnams kyis kyang brdzun pa min zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
translated: The explanation is also not false.

original: de 'dir ji ltar dge ba rnam par rtog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dir ji ltar dge ba rnam par rtog pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this a virtuous conception here?

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir phyag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because of the mudras, etc.

original: gzhan ni 'bum tsho stong phrag go //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'bum tsho stong phrag go //
translated: The others are in the hundreds of thousands.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdud bye ba mnan pa ste ma gsungs kyang snying rje chen pos dmigs nas mtha' med cing thug pa med pa grangs med pa'i bdud mnan pa ni rang gi sems kyi bag chags kyi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'o //
